title: (x) Elegant italic serif in June 2007 issue of Thailand Tatler - Corundum Display {Stephen}
content:
Hey guys, I’m having trouble identifying this beautiful type specimen. It’s from the June 2007 issue of the Thailand Tatler, a magazine I picked up on a recent trip to Bangkok. Does anyone recognize this face? Or if anyone could suggest something similar, that would be helpful as well.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202183916im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Thailand-Tattler_4961.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Duvel neon sign - (similar to) Linotype Auferstehung {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202183916/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36548 "Go to previous forum topic") [Hatteras Yachts logo square oblique sans ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202183916/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36568 "Go to next forum topic")
author: garthclayborn

comments.content:
Is it Mercury Display Italic?

No - but so similar. Wonder if it was a HTF custom job.

this has a nice feel to it. However, the caps are too heavy and the n and h are too wide and the leg gets heavy out of the join too soon (needs more thick-thin contrast like the other letters). I know its not up for critique but its got so many nice things going for it (c e f s g) that I hate to see those unfortunate oddities.  
Just my 2¢

Curious on the ID as well.

My instincts say it is. All the signs of Fournier and Darden are there.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202183916im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/render_4240.png)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202183916im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/render-1_3784.png)

This just in by e-mail from Josh:

_“It is. The display counterpart to Corundum Text, working from Fournier’s largest types (heavy caps and all)._

Confirmed. Good one, Stewf. ;^)
I gotta say, I’m pretty proud of that one.
You have every reason to be — that was some fine display of observation, analysis and deduction. :^)
